oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 3 from oral history interview with Wilbur Foster Creighton, Jr., 1976 August 18
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Wilbur Foster Creighton, Jr., conducted on 18 August 1976 by Ann Wells as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project: Oral History. Creighton discusses the decision to build a more permanent replica of the Parthenon in Nashville after the Tennessee Centennial Exposition of 1897and the selection of architect Russell E. Hart for the project in 1920. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Creighton, Wilbur F., 1906-2004--Interviews; Hart, Russell Eason, 1872-1955
Parthenon (Art museum : Nashville, Tenn.); Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
